moves.2... Nc6 3. g3 Nf6 4. Bg2 d6 5. Nge2: I like the closed Sicilian cos even though move orders can vary the basic idea for white is simple. Control d5, castle, then attack kings side with f4 (usually)
moves.5... e5: I didn't mind seeing this. d5 is now firmly under my control
moves.6. O-O Be7: Usually black opts to develop his black bishop to g7. This is not as good I dont think.
moves.7. d3: I slowly develop along familiar lines.
moves.7... Bg4: I don't get this. It gives me a chance to defend g4 against a future Ng4 and makes room for my king on h2 without losing a tempo.
moves.9... O-O 10. f5: I prefer to gain space rather than open up the middle.
moves.11... Rc8: So he begins operations on my q-side. I think I'm better. I have lots of k-side space for my attack. I don't think he has played too well here. If he had a pawn on g6 with a  fianchettoed bishop behind it, and his e-pawn on e6 not e5, I would not have been able to play f5 so easily. I believe his position is cramped and I am gaining in confidence by this point.
moves.12. Ng3: I want to play g5 but I didn't want Nh5 stopping my Ng3 so I played it first.
moves.12... Ne8: Still cant play g5. So I attack his black sq bishop.
moves.13. Nd5 Bh4 14. Kh2: I defend the knight and free the g-file in case its later possible to get a rook or two on it.
moves.14... b5 15. Be3: Once again I try to pave the way for g5. I plan Qd2.
moves.15... Ne7 16. Nxe7+: This I thought was better than allowing Nxd5.
moves.16... Qxe7 17. Qd2: So now I am ready for g5.
moves.17... h6: I was really surprised at this. It just seems to invite an attack.
moves.18. Nh5: I thought I'd get my knight into position first. Then I'm thinking doubled rooks, Bxh6 followed by Qxh6 then g5 !
moves.18... Nf6: Again, I was surprised cos now I take the initiative.
moves.19. Nxg7 Kxg7 20. Bxh6+ Kh8: I took a while here cos I wanted to to play g5 now but I was worried about Nh5, so I decide to take the material.
moves.21. Bxf8 Rxf8: Here, I also took a long time. I was eyeing g5 (still !) but I was very worried about unleashing the knight to work in conjunction with his bishop and queen around my king. I started thinking that my k-side pawns were OK where they were. His pieces were sort of stifled and blocking each other a bit. I wanted to get my rooks going so...
moves.22. b4: I decided to start play on the q-side. Any comments on this decision would be welcome.
moves.22... cxb4 23. Qxb4 Rc8: I should have defended c2 here.
moves.24. a4: .. but I didnt want to lose time. I planned c4 after bxa4. or if he didnt take it, pxp and the a-file for my rooks
moves.24... a5: I was surprised at this at first but I think he wanted to play Rxc2 without being attacked straight away by my queen. I should have refused and dropped back to d2 then Rc1
moves.25... Rxc2 26. axb5 Nxg4+: The killer blow. Never saw it coming - even now I didnt see the continuation.
moves.28. Qa8+: I thought for a minute I'd found something but I was wrong.
